Liberty ale is a classic, however compared to other American pale ales I didn’t find it so exciting. Maybe it was revolutionary when it came out, but now its hop profile seems quite subdued. Shared bottle at Plonk.

Butelka 0.33L.

Wygląd: Złote, klarowne z iskrą. Piana biała, obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała i ładnie firankuje na ściankach szkła.

Aromat: Aromat chmielowy słodki: dojrzałe mango, pieczone jabłko, żywica do tego toffee. Bardzo przyjemny.

Smak: Delikatne, głównie słodowo, biszkoptowe, lekko owocowe z niewielką grejpfrutową goryczką. Minimalnie metaliczne.

Odczucie: Nasycenie CO2 powyżej średniego, faktura kremowa, ciało poniżej średniego.

Całość: Bardzo delikatne piwo, klasyczne APA, co na obecne standardy bardzo mało chmielowe. Wybitnie pijalne.
Pours a slightly hazy golden. Smells earthy with a mixture of fruits. Pretty carbonated. Somewhat bitter and dry. Tastes are similar to the aromas, but more muted.

355ml bottle from LCBO, Toronto, ON. Pours a hazy dark gold colour with one finger of foamy white head. Flowery aroma with notes of spice and some oranges. A very pleasent IPA-like taste. Not as bitter and spicy as your average American Pale Ale. It’s smooth and refreshing. Lacing clings to the side of the glass. Moderate carbonation.
From a tap at the brewery.The pour is a very slight hazy pale yellow.A light to medium body with a hoppiness and grass notes.
On tap at Salon piva 2014. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is floral, honey, malty. Taste is medium sweet, alcohol, malty, bit fruity.

Transfer from BA review from10-12-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance – The beer pours a quite hazy orange-amber color with a two finger, thick and creamy white head. The head very slowly fades, leaving a nice level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma of the brew is of a citrus nature overall with a good dose of sweet orange and some aromas of a more grapefruit like nature. Along with these aromas, were other smells of fruit, with apple, mango and pear all present. Some bready aromas and a bit of an earthy hop smell round out the aroma profile, producing a rather sweet and balanced IPA smell overall.

 Taste – The taste begins with a biscuit and grapefruit hop taste. There is a little bit of a caramel sweetness upfront, but this is rather light with it growing even lighter as the taste advances further. While the caramel fades, some fruit flavors of lighter fruits comes to the tongue. Along with the fruit flavors, so too comes more hop with more grapefruit as well as an earthy hop flavor coming to the tongue. At the end, a nice floral flavor come to the tongue, rounding out the flavors nicely and producing a drier and nicely moderately hopped flavor to linger on the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is average in terms of its creaminess and thickness with a carbonation level that is on the average side. Both are rather nice for the drier and moderately hopped flavors of the brew, making for a very easy drinking beer.

 Overall – A very enjoyable and easy drinking, moderately hopped brew. Quite tasty overall.
Tastes Like Hops And Cardboard. Aroma is sweet with sugars and grains. Nice pour with fair amount of Carbonation.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 14B). Bottle 355 ml - Batch unknown. AROMA: floral and citrusy hop and esters aromas reminescent of grapes, oranges and some piny and resinous character. some sweet malt background. APPEARANCE: medium gold color and clear. nice moussy head of a slight ivory colour that persists. TASTE: citrusy and piny flavours more faint than the aromas. sweet malt background. medium-high bitterness that lingers into a dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a nice APA that promisses in the aromas but doesnt deliver much in the flavours.

Hazy amber color with rich white mediaum-lasting head. Medium carbonation. Aroma rich is fruits and floral hops, with citrus and sweet malts. Taste is very fruity and citric, spicy and hoppy. Dry finish with a slightly bitterness. Very balanced and refreshing.

Light retention and light lacing. Smells of hops, light citrus and grapefruit. Tastes of sweet malt, grapefruit and pineapple. Light bitter aftertaste.

Ljusgul klar vätska med vit medelstor bestående krona.Frisk ganska söt doft. Smaken är ren och klar med vissa gräsiga inslag. Mycket välbalanserad med en lätt efterbeska. En bra ale
Aroma of mango and other exotic fruits, fruity, light sweet taste, some weeds in there too. Not bad, not great either.

So, this is the famous Anchor Liberty Ale? The original hoppy American pale ale? The beginning of the craft beer revolution? This sweet, sugary, pale malt infested, lager-like stuff? You’re kidding me, right? Ok, so the aroma has some citric notes blended in with the generic fruits and the wet paper, but to call this "heavily hopped" and mean it, you’d probably need a time machine set to 1975. The flavour is a tad more interesting, there are some stingy floral and herbal stuff in the finish, and the citrus is more evident. The finish is also moderate bitter, and back in the good old days that was probably what it took. This one might have been a great beer once, but today if feels under-hopped and totally and utterly uninteresting. 

[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 10 months before BB date, from Systembolaget Gårda, Göteborg]

355ml bottle from the LCBO. Gold body, slight amber tint, with a thin off-white head. Citrus and peach are present in the aroma, floral aroma as well. Medium percieved bitterness. Thin body, very sessionable. Medium carbonation.
355ml bottle. Pours a solid amber with an off-white head. Pine aroma. Robust hops to taste but reasonably smooth with a nice bitter finish. Nice beer.
Bottle. Slightly bitter with only mild hops. A good flavor, just very weak overall. I guess I’m spoiled by Victory brews. Unimpressive.
Clear dark golden with white lacing head. Faint aroma, a little citrus, and some sweet fruit. Decent hoppy flavor and a mild bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with thin off-white head. Lots of lacing. Hoppy, fruity, flowery nose. Taste likewise, peaches, green apples, a bit of pine, grassy, some malty caramel, chemicals. Taste is light sweet to dry, medium bitter. Light astringency on the palate, medium high carbonation, watery. Long chemical bitter finish. Weird.

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))

Aroma : Fruity (peaches, sweet oranges), bubble gum.

Appearance : Clear dark golden color. Minimal white head.

Taste : Fruity, medium sweet, light bitter.

Palate : Medium body. Light sticky texture. Long bitter finish.

Overall : Interesting, balanced, unusual.

Pours a bit paler than most IPAs. Smell is cleaner and less bitter than your average IPA. More piney, less grapefruit/citrus. Taste is similar in that its not your average IPA. Its more crisp and less overwhelmingly bitter. Mouthfeel is a bit thin, but this is expected. This isn’t my favorite beer, but I didn’t expect it to me. It’s not bad.

355ml bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet- and bitterness. Malts, caramel, citrus, grass, pine, herbs and banana. A nice tasteful and refreshing pale ale.

35,5cl bottle from Systembolaget, Strömstad. Pours deep golden to amber with a slightly creamy off-white head. Mild malty aroma with fruity and hoppy notes, citrus, caramel and hints of herbs. Moderate to medium sweet with fruity and herbal flavours and a moderate bitter and slightly dry finish. Decent APA, but not as refreshing as I remembered it.

Famous ale launched in 1975 to remember Paul Revere’s ride in 1775. Creamy, sticky head, warm orange blonde colour; delicate aroma, fresh fruitiness (peach, orange), soft sweet malt taste with fruity and citrussy accents and a long finish of dry-hopping with Cascade, very pleasant. Flawless and perfectly balanced, this lived up to the expectations I had of it.

The smell is probably the best about this beer. Caramel, pine, banana - everything is mixed and everything goes right into your nose.
The taste is a bit less interesting - quite flat, with a little bitterness.
Amberish golden in color. Good head. Nice lacing. Hoppy aroma with a pine hint. Hoppy taste with a citrus taste. Finish is a bitter hop. Good Beer.

Pours clear gold with large white head. Hoppy fresh aroma with heavy pine, citrus, a bit floral. Body has a delicious malt base with biscuits, dried fruit and flowers which is contrasted by a decent hop bitterness. The balance is absolutely perfect and the mouthfeel is very creamy. Long bitter aftertaste. Really impressive.
Bottle. Bright amber body with white head. Aroma is citrus with some alcohol and hints of bread. Taste is some honey with bread. Aftertaste is medium bitter with some herbs and alcohol. Classic.
Very floral hop aroma. Clear golden colour with excellent head. Citrus and passionfruit flavours with bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation.

While staying at my daughters place on holiday (Orange County) I thought would try plenty of local beers and secondly ’well thought of, multi rated’ beers of America that I had not drank before: this is one of those in the later category. Bottle on the balcony: 8th July 2014.

Golden amber body with a full white head. I expected more of a hop blast to be honest, this was subdued and almost subtle in nature. Mildly citrus hops blended with some floral notes and a malty background in the nose and then on into the taste. Maybe having it side by side with a Victory Hop Devil did this beer no favours: even so this still didn’t carry enough character to merit a high score from me. I bit disappointed with a beer and brewery I have heard only good things about.

Aroma of yeast citrus. Surprisingly lacks of much taste, but really waterish and refreshing. One can also feel alcohol which is surprising form a 5,9%. Great bubbly palate. The color is golden with thin head. Quite a good ale for the summer!
Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad vätska med tjockt skum. Blommig doft med en persikoantydan. Mycket fruktig smak med en skön beska.

Aroma: Medium-high hops, woody. Light spicy, some tea-like aromas. Light malt, bready. No DMS, No diecetyl.
Appearance: Clear gold body. Massive frothy/rocky white head.
Flavour: Malt: light, bready. Hops: high, woody. High bitterness, slightly harsh. Bitterness lingers into finish. Dry finish. No DMS, No diecetyl.
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Light astringency, Medium carbonation, creamy.
Overall: A decidedly bitter and hoppy beer, but the astringency and harshness is not to style. Otherwise great aroma and flavours.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Tmavsia oranzova farba, biela pena. Vona ovocna, kvetinova. Chut lahka, prazdnejsia, kvetinove tony, lahko citrus.

Very refreshing as for apa. Nose of tropical and citrus fruits. The taste lacks this nice bitterness, real fruits. Nice light gold/apricot colour. Not havy at all, nicely balanced though.

A damn good Ale that reminds me of freedom and how much I love living in America. All kidding aside, though, it’s an awesome brew with a lot of flavor that doesn’t scare away new drinkers. Definitely a beer to keep on stock for everyday occasions.
Couleur dorée, belle mousse blanche. Nez houblon fruité, raisin, zeste d’agrume. Gout malté houblonné, avec bonnes notes de caramel et amertume en fin de bouche. Très douce a boire.
Clear, light gold pour with a thick white head. Citrus, tropical fruit and malt on the nose. Taste is sweetish, citrusy, malty, quite clean, nice bitterness at the end
